quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [humming] What the hell? No. This is NOT happening.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Didn’t you get the memo? It’s Stairmageddon! [claps and opens the door to the stairwell] Come on Stanley! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Dwight is having maintenance done on the elevator today, and he was really on top of it. Weeks ago, he started the Stairmageddon Awareness campaign. The idea was to get us prepared, both mentally and physically, for a day that hopefully comes once in a 100 years. It’s a… “Mageddon!”

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Come on! Come on, Stanley! Stay in it!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [growls] I put 17 damn years into this company, and now they’re making me climb Stair Mountain!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Come on! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Our office has an unusually large number of… unusually large people.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: This is an abomination.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Come on. You got this. Here.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: So when something as routine as elevator maintenance happens, and people are forced to expend cardiovascular effort, we have to compare it to the end of time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Red alert! Red alert! The reviews are in! I repeat, the reviews are in.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I just got a text from my brother. Scranton Times Tribune.com. There’s a review of the documentary!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [gasps] What does it say?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don’t know, Phyllis! I just got the text and started screaming, “Red Alert.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, the alert was already set to “Red” because of Stairmageddon. You think I should set it to “Double Red”?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I think we should.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [drinks a 5-Hour Energy shot and groans]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: “The Office: An American Workplace airing on PBS next month is a documentary following the employees of Scranton’s own Dunder Mifflin Paper Company!”

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: Whoo! [applause]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: “In this series, which will air starting in May, we get an in-depth look at many interesting local people. There’s Kevin Malone, the falstaffian accountant. Dwight Schrute, the head salesman forever chasing a manager position he will never get.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What does Josh McAuliffe know about the paper business? He works for a news…thing.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: “Andy Bernard, the rudderless trust fund child-slash-middle manager, whose incompetence is emblematic of a declining American economy.”

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Ouch. Sorry, Andy, that’s-.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It’s okay. [chuckles] The hell does he know?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: “A possible explanation for his lack of career focus is his surprising musical talent.”

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I want you to print that out for me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I will.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Now that this documentary is coming out, my days at Dunder Mifflin are probably limited. And you know what? Good. Because this is not what I wanted to do with my life. I wanted to be my generation’s Lisa Loeb.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: “Though it mostly focuses on the daily realities of office life, a lurid subplot reveals the hypocrisy of a local public figure embroiled in a gay affair while preaching family values.”

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh! Which public figure?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I bet it’s Katie Couric. I’ve been saying this for years.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No, I think they mean more like a politician.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [walks into the office grunting and wheezing] You own the building. Why can’t you fix the elevator in the middle of the night? Who do I look like? Jackie Joyner-Kersee?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, I did say it would be an inconvenience. You should have called me from downstairs. We could’ve met in the lobby. It’s time to go out on a sale! Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Son, you’ve lost your mind. I’m not going anywhere until you fix my elevator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The buyer is your sister’s friend. This is the printing paper for the entire school district of Lackawanna. You are coming, and that’s an order.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You are not my damn boss and you never will be! Guess what? Never gonna happen! Pete! Iced tea. Three sugars, five creams.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Your morning 3-by-5. Coming right up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, we won’t be late. I love you, mom. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, your mom’s watching the kids tonight. So what are you two up to? [chuckles] Oh, um, Embassy Suites. “Do Not Disturb” sign on the door. Mommy and Daddy are on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughs] I wish.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: [chuckles] What, then?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, nothing that exciting.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Marriage counseling?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Did you know that is the only kind of counseling I have never had?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You know, Jim’s kind of nervous about it, but I think it could really help.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I mean, we’ve having issues. It can’t hurt to talk about them, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Toby. Um, I wanted to ask you a question.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It’s a little, uh, personal.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Let’s do it. Let’s get personal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I wanted to talk to you about your divorce.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry. I—no, no, no, what I meant—what I meant actually was—

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, no, it’s okay. I can handle it. Um, so…

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You guys obviously went through some tough times leading up to it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [chuckles, snorts]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. I was wondering if you ever did any couple’s counseling.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, sure, lots of times. Yeah. Wait, you and Pam aren’t in couple’s counseling, are you? Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no. Uh, we’re just starting couple’s counseling. Uh, which doesn’t sound any better.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, you guys. Kelly called it. 2013. So s—hey! Hey! Hey, no! No! Get outta here. Clark, get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: My mistake.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yes, it is your mistake. He’s lingering. So annoying. I’m gonna kill him. How can I help? I’m here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That’s all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hello, William Morris Agency. I need to speak with your best agent who represents your biggest stars. Yes, I’ll hold. I’m sorry. I misunderstood. Goodbye. [hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you, Stan. Oh, honey. [Stan closes limo door] Look, I just want our life to get back to normal. Ribbon cuttings, charity balls.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Don’t worry. I’ve scheduled a press conference for later today. We just need to face the camera together. A beloved public servant and his devoted wife. And move on.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: All right, if I have to be the good wife, I’ll be the best damn wife there is. Correction. Best darn wife. Sorry, I’m a better wife than that. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Andy—[knocks] I need to talk to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, come on in. I’m just on hold with another talent agency. It’s insane. This promo with me playing banjo has 250 views already. And every time I click, there’s more. 251. 252. I can’t even keep up!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stanley is refusing to go out on a sales call.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [grunts intensely] I hate people! Why do they never do what you need them to do? Stanley has to go. That’s final.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So what I’m hearing you say is, “Make Stanley go out on the sales call by whatever means possible”?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes! I’m sorry I’m being curt, it’s just I’m about to land a top talent agent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mm-hmm. Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on the phone] Directory? Movie Star department. Back. Directory.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: For five years I’ve held my instincts in check because I wanted to be made manager. Maybe it’s time for me to just let that thought go. It’s kind of painful, but it’s also freeing in a way. Now it’s all about my instincts.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stanley, one way or another, you are gonna come with me to make this sale.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Pass.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hey, c-c-can you just let me out of here before whatever comes next?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don’t worry, it’s just a bull tranquilizer. Nothing to be alarmed about. It’s just a man pointing a bull tranquilizer at a coworker.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Dwight, you do not learn, do you? For a threat to be credible, you ha—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [fires tranquilizer gun at Stanley]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Holy [bleep].

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No, you didn’t. Sick of you and your—ooh—

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [fires tranquilizer gun twice]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [falls to the floor with a loud thud]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s all right. Andy approved it.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Man, he’s really in twinkle town now.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Is he gonna be okay? I mean, weren’t those darts intended for an animal, like, two to three times larger than him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, this dosage was meant for a very small bull, and Stanley’s got way more body fat than they do.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: You gave him three shots.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shh. Got about 45 minutes to get him to the client before he comes to. [claps] Grab his feet. [grunts] Let’s go!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Move it! One, two, three. [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He’s like a manatee. Ready? Let’s go again. Come on. We can do this. One, two, three! [Stanley’s head hits the door frame] Oh, God.  No wonder my elevator cables are under such strain.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: We gotta get a wheelbarrow or something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [grunts] Okay, we’re good. We’re good. Let’s go. Push!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I am!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Any good weekend plans?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I might see a movie.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What about you?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Uh, I don’t know yet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [grunts] Let’s take him—

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I was thinking about…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let’s go right to the top of the stairs, okay?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: And then what?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, listen. I’m kind of embarrassed to admit this, but I’ve never actually done this before.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Well, if I may, you’re a natural.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you. I mean, I’ve rehearsed it in my head like 1,000 times, but, uh…

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: That’s a little weird.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know. Evel Knievel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [wraps tape around Stanley’s body]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: [connect helmet straps around Stanley’s head] That’s about as good as that’s gonna be.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, now here’s the plan. I’m gonna launch him. I need you to go to the bottom and catch him.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Catch?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I can’t catch him. He’s like, 250 pounds.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You use your hands and just blunt his descent, okay? He’s gonna be moving slowly. It’s only—

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Blunt?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s 15 feet down, it’s at a 45-degree angle. Get set in your haunches, it’s like your catching a medicine—

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Dude, this size of my haunches— [Stanley’s body slips down the stairs and his head thumps into a wall]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. Good call. He would have put a hole in your chest same as he put a hole in that wall.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: We should probably call a doctor or something, dude.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [slides down the stairs and lands next to Stanley] You okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So how does it work? It’s like, you know, the action of talking to a third party breaks up the log jam, or…

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You’re really there to talk to each other. I would say that the therapist is more of a facilitator.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: He might start by asking each of you, “Why do you think you’re here?”

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He took this job in Philly without telling me. He bought our house without telling me. At a certain point, he shouldn't be rewarded for that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: If I didn’t do certain things without telling Pam, she’d be married to Roy. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I feel like he’s always making these decisions for the family, and then I’m left playing catch-up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: If she can just hang on for a little while longer, I—this will be so huge for our family.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, what’s a little while?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I mean, what’s the end date? It must be really hard for her to sign on to be unhappy if she doesn’t know when it’s gonna end.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That’s kind of an impossible question.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, guys, it’s starting! Hurry!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ooh, there’s Angela! I work with her!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Huh, yeah. [chuckles] I mean, I’m happy Angela’s the first one getting famous, but it’s a little weird, no? I mean, she can’t sing or act, so it’s actually kind of insane, if you think about it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Her hair looks beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, we get it, Phyllis, she looks like a freakin’ movie star! [kicks trash can]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [on the computer screen] I would just to start by saying that there have been some rumors about my personal life that I would like to settle once and for all. As my long-suffering wife can attest… I am gay.

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.line: [surprised chatter]

quotes.speaker: Reporter #1
quotes.line: Senator, were always gay, or did your wife turn you gay?

quotes.speaker: Reporter #2
quotes.line: Question for the Senator’s beard.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [on the computer screen] I’ll say it again for mis amigos latinos. Yo soy homosexual.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Poor Angela.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah. Poor Angela.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I once believed that a gay person could be somewhat straight. It wasn’t until my marriage to Angela that I realized how…charmless I find the female body.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Oof. Always hurts to hear that one.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: There’s someone else I need to thank. His name is Oscar Martinez.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Oscar is the one who opened my eyes to who I really am. For the first time—

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oscar is with the Senator too?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes! And I knew it the whole time! I kept the secret. I kept the secret so good. You didn’t know, you didn’t know, and you didn’t freaking know. But I knew! [claps]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: He knew!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes, we did it!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You did it, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yes! Ohh! I did it. Ohh, I did it.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: --with this new self-awareness, I was finally able to find love at long last. With my amazing… Chief of Staff Wesley Silver.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: What?!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Wesley Silver’s gay?

quotes.speaker: Crowd
quotes.line: [surprised chatter]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [gasps]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: They make a nice couple.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [gags]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Almost there. Almost there. [opens car door] Okay. We’re running late. Let’s get him inside.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: We can’t just leave him bubble wrapped like this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you kidding me? The bubble wrap is the only thing that’s stopping his suit from getting wrinkled. These meetings are all about presentation.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: That’s actually really smart.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: God, if only there was any other use or situation for that kind of knowledge.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let’s get him inside.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Carla Fern is not just an actor’s agent. She does writers, directors, travel, and real estate.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Actor?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Oh, no. [chuckles] Well, I have an act. Dog, cat, mouse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, wow, cool. Is it hard to train them to do that?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Eh, you go through a lot of mice.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: If started by accident as these things tend to do. You know, I was setting down my cat, and I accidently put her on top of my dog, and I was, like, so mad at myself at first. And then I was, like, wait. Wait a second.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Does anything go on top of the mouse?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Yeah. Little hat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aw, that’s cute.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What’s the mouse’s name?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Eh, you know, it really doesn’t make sense to name the mice. They’re kinda like cannon fodder, you know? You’re not one of those PETA guys , are you? [cat jumps off dog] Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hey, wait, wait, how—how are we doing this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, I’ll grab the forelegs, and you push his hindquarters.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Just say “arms” and “legs,” okay? That just—that’s the vernacular that I’m comfortable with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Fine, let’s go. [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hoist his shank on three.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Wha—What’s a shank?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s by the tenderloin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Roll him, roll him, roll him. Good. Good. Okay, careful, he’s slouching. Okay, can you—sl-slouch him into the seat. [sighs] Here. Here. Go around and get his seatbelt. [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Got it?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Yeah—yup yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [grunts and closes car door] Get in the back.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get in the back.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Aw, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Get in.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, Stanley? Do you understand what we’re about to do?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Helllloooo!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Okay. We, hey—hey, listen, listen. We are going to go discuss paper contracts for city of Lackawanna public schools, okay?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Pigeons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, God, this is bad. Looks like we’ve got no choice. You, my friend, are going to have to be Stanley Hudson.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Isn’t the client, like, best friends with his sister?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: New plan, okay? We get him a cup of coffee and we go back to the old plan. Let’s go! Gimme a hand. Here we go. Come on, Stanley! Here we go. Upsie-doozie. There we go. Okay, all right. Come on, big guy. You can walk, right? Yeah. What a pretty smile. Let’s go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I’m sure Athlead will be a huge success. But I don’t want him to do it anymore, and I don’t want to give him an ultimatum, but I am not moving our family to Philly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, if Pam says she won’t go, then—[chuckles] we’re gonna need a lot more than counseling. Hmph.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: That was exhausting.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Blah blah blah blah. Jim.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Well, they deserve each other, then.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: They do. That they do.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: That is for sure.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [whispers] That they do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And for—oh, whoopsie daisy. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Davis
quotes.line: Stanley, what is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He’s fine. He gets carsick really easily.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Driving.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s a long drive. He was in the backseat. But right now we’re talking to Mrs. Davis about the full range of the products that we offer and our competitive rates, right, Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Ooh-hoo, look at that baby…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Ohhh…

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Davis
quotes.line: That’s Benji in the middle.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: That’s Benji. Oh, he’s precious. That’s a healthy-looking baby.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Davis
quotes.line: Very special little boy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Look at him. I’ve never seen such a beautiful child.

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Davis
quotes.line: Funny sense of humor. If you push on his nose, he’ll go, “eee.”

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Like this? Watch.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Eee.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.line: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Mrs. Davis
quotes.line: Like that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: A beautiful family.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughs] Right? Come on!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, maybe I’ll never be manager, but I just managed to get our most stubborn salesman to close a sale with one of our biggest clients, and I must say, it’s the most pleasant I’ve ever seen Stanley. I think we should consider injecting him with bull tranquilizer on a daily basis.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: So, what can you do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Australian accent] Well, what can’t I do? Right, I can sing, I can dance, I can play the banjo, innit? And if you hadn’t noticed, I’ve got a pretty good British accent.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Can you drive a car?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: At the risk of sounding arrogant, I did drive myself here.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Why do you have, uh, a high school musical here on your resume? What are you, like, 40? 45?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My exact age is 28 to 34, so basically just send me out on whatever Jake Gyllenhaal’s going out on.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Gyllenhaal, got it. Can you juggle and crap?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: : Yes. And yes. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Would you dress up as, say, a birthday clown and go to a kid’s party, let ‘em throw pies at ya?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whereas that is not why I have entered show business, I do understand that you have to build credibility. [sniffs] I’m all for it.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Well, Mr. Bernard, I’m gonna be honest with you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, at least I tried. Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: Uh, no. We’re—we’re gonna take you on as a client.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You are? Yes! Yes. Are you being for real right now? Oh, man. Ah, yes! I need this so bad. I really think this is what could fix me.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.line: We are extremely excited to be working with you too, sir. Pay Todd on your way out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Most talent agents take 10% of whatever jobs they get you, but with Carla you pay a flat rate of $5,000 up front. And that includes headshots.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: Uh, it doesn’t include headshots.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It doesn’t include headshots.

quotes.speaker: Todd Packer
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, of course not, because that would be insane if it did. Still getting a bargain, though.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: So I just smiled and complimented her grandkids, and we closed it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You earned yourself a nice, fat commission and you didn’t even know it. I’ll go tell Andy the good news. Oh. [chuckles] Silly me. Gotta take the stairs.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Oh, no, I’m not doing that again. You got me down, you gotta get me back up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well—no, no—n—

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [stabs his own leg with a tranquilizer dart and falls to the ground]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [stomps on the ground] We need a winch and a hoist.
